results.title: Caroline Chisholm: the emigrant's friend
results.brief_description: This incredibly energetic and intelligent woman stands out as one of the few women who have been recognised throughout Australia’s history. She was called a saint in her own lifetime. Caroline Chisholm pioneered migrant welfare and helped the most disadvantaged groups of all; the women and children, the poor and uneducated, the ignorant and the persecuted. She achieved more in her lifetime than almost anyone else in our history.

results.title: Carolin and the Frog
results.brief_description: Fact meets fantasy in the forests of East Gippsland. Carolin is a city kid; she doesn’t like the bush. Her parents are excited about their holiday in East Gippsland but to Carolin it spells dirt, insects and discomfort…until she encounters a frog! She rushes into the bush to find her voice and discovers the enchantment of the forest. Deals with the flora and fauna of East Gippsland and explores the meaning of wilderness.

results.creator_credit: Gerald H Thompson, National Geographic Society and Oxford Scientific Films
results.brief_description: Features plants which eat animals, including the Venus Fly-trap, the sundew plant, the bladderwort and the pitcher plant. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Carmen
results.brief_description: Glyndebourne provides the backdrop for Bizet’s “Carmen”. This new Peter Hall production is a torrid drama of passion, blood and squalor, with sets that capture the earthy warmth of Spain. Maria Ewing sings the title role. Rated: G

results.title: Cargoes
results.brief_description: The “Ionian” (a cargo ship) leaves London at the end of July 1939 to deliver cargo to the British owned ports in the Mediterranean area such as Malta and Cyprus, passing on the way many of the British naval ships as they prepare for the second World War a month later. No other credits available.

results.title: Career soldier
results.brief_description: Shows the transformation from civilian to soldier at Kapooka in New South Wales, and describes the life of a modern career soldier. His uniforms are tailor-made, he reaches a new peak of physical fitness, he is encouraged to raise his educational level, he is better fed and better housed than ever before, he is trained in specialist skills and paid accordingly.

results.title: Career in retail selling. No. 8. Success story [B&W]
results.brief_description: Set in a fashion department we meet a would-be writer, Miss Barry, who has been with the store for one year. In her conversation with another sales clerk, Mimsy, she emphasizes the benefits of being familiar with the stock and with reading trade magazines to keep up on new trends. Miss Barry gets a promotion to assistant fashion buyer and Mimsy is hired. Her contact with Miss Barry convinces her that she too can have a career in retail selling.
